channel.title: CVE Feed for smashballoon -- all
channel.description: The latest CVEs for smashballoon -- all products

item.title: CVE-2023-4841|2023-09-14T02:29:50.124Z -- smashballoon -- feeds%20for%20youtube%20%28youtube%20video%2C%20channel%2C%20and%20gallery%20plugin%29
item.description: The Feeds for YouTube for WordPress plugin for WordPress is vulnerable to Stored Cross-Site Scripting via 'youtube-feed' shortcode in versions up to, and including, 2.1 due to insufficient input sanitization and output escaping on user supplied attributes. This makes it possible for authenticated attackers with contributor-level and above permissions to inject arbitrary web scripts in pages that will execute whenever a user accesses an injected page.

item.title: CVE-2024-0379|2024-02-20T18:56:23.650Z -- smashballoon -- custom%20twitter%20feeds%20%E2%80%93%20a%20tweets%20widget%20or%20x%20feed%20widget
item.description: The Custom Twitter Feeds â€“ A Tweets Widget or X Feed Widget plugin for WordPress is vulnerable to Cross-Site Request Forgery in all versions up to, and including, 2.2.1. This is due to missing or incorrect nonce validation on the ctf_auto_save_tokens function. This makes it possible for unauthenticated attackers to update the site's twitter API token and secret via a forged request granted they can trick a site administrator into performing an action such as clicking on a link.
